TopicTitle: Post a screenshot of what your first flight is doing

Articles.Content:
To be clear, post a screenshot of the earliest possible flight that's STILL in flight. This can be done by going to the tracking station and picking the first one on the list.

Here's one of my first ships, in orbit around the sun.

(Take a look at that timer!) That's 48.357 years!

Lol what a nooby craft.

(So that's where my Jebediah is! I thought he was dead.. Good news everyone, I'm sending a rescue crew after him!)

Edited November 4, 2013 by CrazedGunman502

The game has destroyed my save files many times over since then...

The earliest save files I have now are from .21 which isn't that long ago and certainly not my first flight.

If save files had not been destroyed... the earliest ship I would have had that would still be in flight would by the one I got into Mun orbit way back in .13 before we had the map view.
Lol what's the lifespan of a kerbal?

My oldest ship still in flight is the Lewis Lander in orbit around Duna...it has been floating there for about 19.4 years. It still has fuel and lots of monopropellant. Of course, the side tanks that had the landing gear attached were dropped when it boosted back up from the surface of Duna to the mothership...but who knows when it might prove useful in the future? There is also the Clark Lander in orbit around Duna from that same mission (that lander had gone to Ike and then returned to the mothership).
